intro: Ipomoea ramosissima f. rosea, commonly known as the roseate morning glory, is a variant of the common morning glory, characterized by its striking pink to rose-colored flowers. This plant is a herbaceous vine native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and can grow up to 10 feet in length. The flowers bloom in the morning and close by midday, a trait typical of the morning glory genus. Botanically, it is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
